ofx:section.ofx:paragraph:
This chapter contains the basic ideas and concepts everyone need to work with MEIS comfortably. At the beginning we give an overview of the functionalities of MEIS. This includes a quick tour through the elements of the screen and how to \gls{c4} to the system. To log in is mandatory for accessing most of the MEIS functionalities. Next topic is the navigation concept. The MEIS is offering a wide range of functionalities for different user groups. Hereby, we have to ensure that the navigation through the MEIS remains easy to understand and simple to handle. Hereafter we give an introduction to the general usage of input fields and tables. After being familiar with all the basics of the MEIS, the different sections such as Project, Program, Social Protection or Repotrs are described in detail. Hereby, every user shall focus on his/her own use cases when it comes to the different sections. For instance, if you are not in charge of Social Protection, you can skip this part.
In general, the MEIS is web-based, so you will use it through a \gls{c2}. Nevertheless, the MEIS's use is quite different from standard web pages. The MEIS is what is called a \gls{c3}. In short, MEIS is rather similar to Google Mail than to common web pages of newspapers.

ofx:highlight.ofx:paragraph: Note, because of the web-based nature of the system, the browser will ask the server for information. for example, if you save a project the data will be sent to the server and there it will be stored in the central database. Because of that: Do Not Perform Button Smashing! Please do not press a button multiple times while waiting for a system response. Hitting the button once will trigger the function. In case the system does not respond immediately, the reason is most likely due to network problems.
